item.title: Post 1
item.description: Types of Coffee Beans There are primarily four main types of coffee beans that are widely recognized and cultivated for commercial use. These are Arabica, Robusta, Liberica, and Excelsa. Here’s a breakdown of each: Arabica (Coffea arabica): Origins: Indigenous to the forests of the southwestern highlands of Ethiopia. Description: Known for its smooth, mild flavor with slightly acidic tones and a range of nuanced flavors depending on the region of cultivation.
